remarks: Sylow's first theorem.  If ` P ^ N ` is a prime power that divides the cardinality of ` G ` , then ` G ` has a supgroup with size ` P ^ N ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
statement:
sylow1.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
sylow1.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
sylow1.f $e |- ( ph -> X e. Fin ) $.
sylow1.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
sylow1.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
sylow1.d $e |- ( ph -> ( P ^ N ) || ( # ` X ) ) $.
sylow1 $p |- ( ph -> E. g e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ( # ` g ) = ( P ^ N ) ) $.
$d G g $.
$d N g $.
$d P g $.
$d X g $.
$d g ph $.
